questions.question: Which factor helped in the rise of Indian nationalism?
questions.answer: English education

questions.question: Which organization was founded in 1885 to lead the national movement?
questions.answer: Indian National Congress

questions.question: Who was the first President of the Indian National Congress?
questions.answer: W.C. Banerjee

questions.question: Who played a key role in the establishment of the Indian National Congress?
questions.answer: A.O. Hume

questions.question: Which language became a common link among Indians?
questions.answer: English

questions.question: What policy did the British use to weaken nationalism?
questions.answer: Divide and Rule

questions.question: Which newspaper was started by Lokmanya Tilak?
questions.answer: Kesari

questions.question: Who were known as Moderate leaders?
questions.answer: Gokhale, Dadabhai Naoroji

questions.question: The extremist leaders believed in ____.
questions.answer: Mass agitation

questions.question: Partition of Bengal took place in which year?
What is nationalism?
questions.answer: Nationalism is a feeling of unity and love for one’s country.

questions.question: Why did English education help nationalism?
questions.answer: It introduced ideas of liberty, equality and democracy.

questions.question: Who founded the Indian National Congress?
questions.answer: The Indian National Congress was founded by A.O. Hume in 1885.

questions.question: Who were Moderates?
questions.answer: Moderates were leaders who believed in constitutional and peaceful methods.

questions.question: What was the importance of the Partition of Bengal?
questions.answer: It led to widespread national awakening and protest.
